pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:1.1.2: For the meaning of _senāsana_, see Appendix of Technical Terms.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.1.9: For a discussion of these and those below, see Appendix II on furniture.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.1.15: I have rendered _muñja_-reed and _pabbaja_-reed with the single word “reed”. I am not aware that these different species of reed can be properly distinguished in English.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.2.4: Sp 2.112: _Cimilikā nāma sudhādiparikammakatāya bhūmiyā vaṇṇānurakkhaṇatthaṁ katā hoti, taṁ heṭṭhā pattharitvā upari kaṭasārakaṁ pattharanti_—“A _cimilikā_ is made to protect the color of a floor that has been plastered, etc. It is spread out underneath, with a straw-mat spread out on top.” | Sp-yoj 1.112: _Cammakhaṇḍoti ettha cammaṁyeva ante khaṇḍattā chinnattā cammakhaṇḍoti vuccati_, “Here _cammakhaṇḍa_ is just a hide. Because it is cut up within and made of pieces, it called a _cammakhaṇḍa_.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc14:2.3.6: Sp 2.113: _Kenaci palibuddhaṁ hotīti senāsanaṁ kenaci upaddutaṁ hotīti attho_, “_Kenaci palibuddhaṁ hoti_: the meaning is that the furniture is controlled by something.”
